description:
at The College Board in Topeka, Kansas, United States Job DescriptionCollege Board - Global Strategy & Talent at The College Board in Topeka, Kansas, United States Job DescriptionCollege Board - Global Strategy & Talent100% Remote (EST)About the Strategy TeamThe Strategy Team is responsible for developing and executing the strategic vision and direction of the College Board. We work closely with the executive leadership team, business units, and external partners to identify opportunities and challenges, evaluate options, and implement solutions that advance our mission of expanding access to higher education. Our expertise is applying analytical frameworks, data-driven insights, and innovative thinking to address complex and dynamic issues in the education sector.We are a diverse and collaborative team of strategists, analysts, and project managers who enjoy learning from each other and sharing our knowledge and skills. Our team culture is based on trust, respect, and continuous improvement. We celebrate our successes and learn from our failures. We are passionate about making a positive impact on students, educators, and society.About the OpportunityWe are clearing a path for all students to own their futures by equipping students and schools with high-quality career navigation, preparation, and acceleration. College Board sees career success as the destination and education as the pathway to get there.College Board has a proven track record of delivering high-quality opportunities to students at scale, ensuring more students from all backgrounds are prepared for a successful future. Because of our national reach to more than 7 million students, we're uniquely positioned to leverage insights from those conversations and ongoing interactions to provide all students with a wide range of opportunities.As the ED, Career Strategy & Partnerships, you will build on our progress to lead this organizational initiative by developing overarching strategy for our careers work, facilitating cross-programmatic connections, and leading the College Board's external agenda in the career education space.In this role, you will:Lead and facilitate cross-enterprise careers strategy.Work with program, functional leaders, and Executive Leadership Team to set, drive, and track ambitious goals aligned with strategic/programmatic priorities and support them to meet those goals.Align, connect, and inform cross-programmatic priorities and product strategy.Explore new opportunities and markets to increase value proposition of College Board programs via careers/workforce.Own and lead strategy for shared careers/workforce partnershipsSet vision and approach for how to build up employer networks and diversify workforce champions for new and existing programs.Manage or support others to manage key employer and workforce partnerships and ensure strategic engagement across programmatic needs.Work with the College Board's membership team to include workforce/employer partners and more deeply engage community colleges in our membership.Lead College Board's external agenda in workforce/careersRepresent College Board's career-relevant portfolio at high-profile workforce events.Work with program and Communications/Marketing to clarify brand strategy and voice in new workforce space, including elevating College Board as career education experts.Train field staff and keep internal stakeholders informed on the College Board's careers initiatives.Develop understanding of market intelligence and communicate to key stakeholders.Manage two direct reports and collaborate with cross-functional leads to implement, sustain, and strengthen careers investments.Manage two staff members, one who leads our program work for BigFuture and the SAT Suite and another who manages much of our partnerships work.Serve as a coach and guide to career programs and consult on key decisions.Work with programs and field staff to determine sales strategy for careers-focused offerings.Work with policy team to ensure an aligned policy agenda, particularly in key states, that supports programmatic goals and objectives.Work with research team to develop and pursue learning agenda to measure and improve our work.About you, you have:Strong ability to set vision and direction and drive impact across a large organization - you make things happen in professional and academic settings.Outstanding knowledge of emerging trends, best practices, and a deep network in workforce/career educationAdept problem-solving skills, including using data to inform decisions and actions.Superb ability to build relationships and influence others to action.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including facilitating meetings and presenting remotely and in-person to large groups and in high-visibility settings.Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, across lines of difference.Experienced manager with a track record of helping team members succeed and grow.A passion for continuous learning and improvement, and ability to support others to grow together.A passion for supporting educational and career opportunities for millions of students.About the ProcessApplication submission window will begin immediately and will be accepted through February 9, 2024. We will review and respond to applications on a rolling basis during this period.The hiring process will include resume and application submission, recruiter phone screen, hiring manager interview (with work samples), performance exercise (such as drafting a short presentation or producing a writing sample), interviews with key partners and direct reports (2), and Reference Checks (approximately 8-week process).About Our Benefits & CompensationCollege Board offers a competitive benefits and compensation program that attracts top talent looking to make a difference in education. As a self-sustaining non-profit, we believe in compensating employees equitably in relation to each other, their qualifications, their impact, and the relevant market.The hiring range for a new employee in this position is $144,000 to $220,000. College Board differentiates salaries by location so where you live will narrow the portion of this range in which you can expect a salary.Your salary will be carefully determined based on your location, relevant experience, the external labor market, and the pay of College Board employees in similar roles. College Board strives to provide our best offer up front based on these criteria.Your salary is only one part of all that College Board offers, including but not limited to:A comprehensive package designed to support the well-being of employees and their families and promote education. Our robust benefits package includes health, dental, and vision insurance, generous paid time off, paid parental leave, fertility benefits, pet insurance, tuition assistance, retirement benefits, and more.Recognition of exceptional performance through annual bonuses, salary growth over time through market increases, and opportunities for merit raises and promotions based on increased scope of responsibility.A job that matters, a team that cares, and a place to learn, innovate and thrive.You can expect to have transparent conversations about benefits and compensation with our recruiters throughout your application process.#LI-TheAcorn#LI-Remote
#J-18808-Ljbffr
